pageContext.description:
In this image the head of a young woman and that of an elderly bearded man are inclined towards each other and rendered in great detail. [...] However this is without doubt a study from a workshop reservoir. 
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 204]
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 19.5 x 24.4 x 0.6 cm
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 204]

involvedPersons.suffix: Copy after a prototype from the Cranach workshop

pageContext.markings:
Reverse:
- handwritten: 'N 40', '104', 'IV', 'Witten/(illegible)'
- adhesive label: HKA Nr. 83 'Meister L. C. 1520 Cranach männlicher und weiblicher Kopf/Schule Cranachs'
- adhesive label: KVC
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 2014]

metadata.title: Bearded Man with a Young Woman

pageContext.provenance:
- Gotha, Art Cabinet, Friedenstein Castle (Kunstkammer Schloss Friedenstein) 
- 1856 Ducal Art and Antiquities Collection, Coburg (Herzogliche Kunst- und Altertümersammlung der Veste Coburg (HKA))
- 1919 Kunstsammlungen der Veste Coburg (KVC) 
- 1921 exhibited in the residential quarters of the Ducal Palace (Fürstenbau), Coburg
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 204]

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
Support:
- attached to a lime wood board. a few saw marks are visible. The surface has been stained a reddish brown. The original support is torn in some places at the edge and has developed blisters. At the bottom left there is a triangular insert. 
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 204]

pageContext.signature:
Artist's insignia at the top right: winged serpent with dropped wings, and 'LC/1520' 
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 204]
Probably not authentic [cda 2019]

titles.title: Bearded Man with a Young Woman
